main event: The object was observed by the observer for about 15 seconds at an altitude of 15,000 to 20,000 feet. It was brilliant white in color and appeared to be travelling at a high rate of speed.
interesting points: The observer believes the object was about the size of a thumbnail held at arm's length.
The object had no trail or sound.
The report suggests the object could be a meteor, satellite, or other unidentified object.
A similar sighting was also reported by the M/V Geisha in the Pacific Ocean, where a brilliant meteor or satellite was observed for 15 minutes.
The weather conditions during the M/V Geisha sighting included partly cloudy skies, an east wind force of 4, and a barometer of 29.3 inches.
sighted object: A brilliant white object traveling at high speed
